BindSecurityTemplateToEntity.document: This API is used to bind/unbind a domain name to/from a specific policy template.
BindSecurityTemplateToEntity.name: Binds/Unbinds a domain name to/from a security policy template

BindSharedCNAME.document: This API is used to bind/unbind a domain name to/from a shared CNAME. It is now only available to beta users.
BindSharedCNAME.name: Binds with a shared CNAME

BindZoneToPlan.document: This API is used to bind a site to a plan.
BindZoneToPlan.name: Binds a site to a plan.

CheckCnameStatus.document: This API is used to query the CNAME status of a domain name.
CheckCnameStatus.name: Queries the CNAME status of a domain name

ConfirmOriginACLUpdate.document: This API is used to confirm that the latest origin ACLs have been updated to the origin server firewall when the origin ACLs change. After confirming the update to the latest version, related change notifications will stop pushing.
ConfirmOriginACLUpdate.name: Confirm Origin ACLs Update

CreateAccelerationDomain.document:
This API is used to create an acceleration domain name. 

For sites connected via the CNAME, if you have not verified the ownership of the domain name, the ownership verification information of the domain name is returned. To verify your ownership of the domain name, see [Ownership Verification](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70789?from_cn_redirect=1).
CreateAccelerationDomain.name: Connects a domain to EdgeOne

CreateAliasDomain.document:
This API is used to create an alias domain name.
The feature is only supported by the enterprise plan and is currently in closed beta testing. If you need to use it, please [contact us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service?from=connect-us).
CreateAliasDomain.name: Creates an alias domain name.

CreateApplicationProxy.document: This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version [CreateL4Proxy] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103417?from_cn_redirect=1).
CreateApplicationProxy.name: Creates an application proxy (legacy)

CreateApplicationProxyRule.document: This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. For details, see [CreateL4ProxyRules] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103416?from_cn_redirect=1).
CreateApplicationProxyRule.name: Creates an application proxy rule (legacy)

CreateCLSIndex.document: This API is used to create key-value indexes for relevant delivered log fields in the corresponding Tencent Cloud CLS log topic for a specified real-time log delivery task (task-id). If such indexes have been created in CLS, this API will append indexes through merging.
CreateCLSIndex.name: Creates a CLS index

CreateConfigGroupVersion.document: This API is used to create a new version for the specified configuration group in version management mode. The version management feature is currently undergoing beta testing and is accessible only to users on the whitelist.
CreateConfigGroupVersion.name: Create Configuration Group Version

CreateContentIdentifier.document: This API is used to create content identifiers, where you can set descriptions, tags, and other information. It is also necessary to bind an enterprise edition package for billing data statistics. A content identifier can only bind one billing package, while a billing package can bind multiple content identifiers. This feature is only available to the allowlist.
CreateContentIdentifier.name: Create content identifiers

CreateCustomizeErrorPage.document: This API is used to create a custom response page.
CreateCustomizeErrorPage.name: Creates a custom response page

CreateDnsRecord.document: After creating a site and the site is accessed in NS mode, you can create DNS records through this API.
CreateDnsRecord.name: Creates a dns record

CreateFunction.document: This API is used to create and deploy an edge function to EdgeOne edge nodes.
CreateFunction.name: Creates an edge function

CreateFunctionRule.document: This API is used to create a trigger rule for an edge function.
CreateFunctionRule.name: Creates a trigger rule for an edge function

CreateJustInTimeTranscodeTemplate.document:
JIT transcoding already provides preset transcoding templates to meet most needs. If there are personalized transcoding requirements, you can create custom transcoding templates through this API, with up to 100 custom transcoding templates allowed.
This API is used to ensure the consistency of JIT transcoding effect, avoid video output exceptions caused by EO cache or M3U8 sharding template changes during the process, and templates cannot be modified after creation.
This API is used to learn about the detailed capacity of JIT transcoding. EdgeOne video instant processing function introduction (https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/1552/111927?from_cn_redirect=1).
CreateJustInTimeTranscodeTemplate.name: Create a just-in-time transcoding template

CreateL4Proxy.document: This API is used to create Layer 4 proxy instances.
CreateL4Proxy.name: Creates Layer 4 proxy instances

CreateL4ProxyRules.document: This API is used to create Layer 4 proxy instance rules, supporting both individual and batch creation.
CreateL4ProxyRules.name: Creates Layer 4 proxy forwarding rules

CreateL7AccRules.document: This API is used to create rules in the [rule engine](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70901?from_cn_redirect=1). Batch creation is supported.
CreateL7AccRules.name: Create layer-7 acceleration rules

CreateLoadBalancer.document: This API is used to create a LoadBalancer. For details, see [Quickly Create Load Balancers](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/104223?from_cn_redirect=1). The load balancing feature is in beta test. If you need to use it, [contact us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service).
CreateLoadBalancer.name: Creates a LoadBalancer

CreateMultiPathGateway.document: Create a multi-channel security acceleration gateway via this API, including Cloud Gateway (gateway created and managed by Tencent Cloud) and private gateway (gateway deployed by users). Query the status using DescribeMultiPathGateway, and creation is successful if the status is online.
CreateMultiPathGateway.name: Create a multi-channel security acceleration gateway

CreateMultiPathGatewayLine.document: This API is used to create lines integrated with the multi-channel security acceleration gateway, including EdgeOne Layer-4 proxy and custom lines.
CreateMultiPathGatewayLine.name: Create a multi-channel security acceleration gateway route

CreateMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.document: This API creates an access key for the multi-channel security acceleration gateway. Customers use the access key to sign requests for accessing the gateway. Each site can have only one key, which is applicable to all gateways under that site. Query the key via the DescribeMultiPathGatewaySecretKey API.
CreateMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.name: Create a multi-channel security acceleration gateway key

CreateOriginGroup.document: This API is used to create an origin group for easy management. The created origin server group can be used for **adding acceleration domain names** and **layer-4 proxy configuration**.
CreateOriginGroup.name: Creates an origin group

CreatePlan.document:
If you need to use the EdgeOne product, you must create a billing plan through this interface.
> After creating a plan, you need to complete the process of creating a site and binding the plan through [CreateZone](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/80719?from_cn_redirect=1), so that the EdgeOne can provide services properly.
CreatePlan.name: Creates plan

CreatePlanForZone.document: This API is used to purchase a plan for a new site.
CreatePlanForZone.name: Purchase a plan for a new site

CreatePrefetchTask.document: This API is used to create a pre-warming task.
CreatePrefetchTask.name: This API is used to create a pre-warming task.

CreatePurgeTask.document:
When there are resources updated on the origin with the TTL remaining valid, users cannot access the latest resources. In this case, you can purge the cache using this API. There are two methods:
  • Delete: This method deletes the node cache without verification and retrieves the latest resources from the origin when receiving a request.
  • Invalidate: This method marks the node cache as invalid and sends a request with the If-None-Match and If-Modified-Since headers to the origin. If the origin responses with 200, the latest resources are retrieved to be cached on the node. If a 304 response is returned, the latest resources are not cached on the node.
    • For more details, see [Cache Purge](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70759?from_cn_redirect=1).
CreatePurgeTask.name: This API is used to create a cache purging task.

CreateRealtimeLogDeliveryTask.document:
This API is used to create a real-time log delivery task.
The following restrictions apply:

- When the log type (`LogType`) is site acceleration log (L7 access log) (`domain`), L4 proxy log (`application`), or Edge Function execution log (`function`), the same entity (L7 domain, L4 proxy instance, or Edge Function instance) can be added to only one of the following `TaskType` combinations within the same `LogType`-`Area` pair:
    - One task delivering to Tencent Cloud CLS plus one task delivering to a custom HTTP(S) endpoint;
    - One task delivering to Tencent Cloud CLS plus one task delivering to an AWS S3-compatible bucket.
- When the log type (`LogType`) is rate-limiting & CC attack protection log (`web-rateLiming`), managed rule log (`web-attack`), custom rule log (`web-rule`), or bot management log (`web-bot`), the same entity can be added to only one real-time log delivery task within the same `LogType`-`Area` pair.

Before creating a task, we recommend that you first call [DescribeRealtimeLogDeliveryTasks](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/104110?from_cn_redirect=1) to list existing tasks for the entity and verify whether it has already been added to another task.
CreateRealtimeLogDeliveryTask.name: Creates a real-time log delivery task

CreateRule.document:
This interface is the old version of the rule engine creation interface. EdgeOne has fully upgraded the rule engine related interfaces on January 21, 2025. For details on the new version of the seven-layer acceleration rule creation interface, please refer to [CreateL7AccRules](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115822?from_cn_redirect=1).

Note: Starting from January 21, 2025, the old version of the interface will stop updating and iteration. Subsequent new features will only be provided in the new version of the interface, and the original capabilities supported by the old version of the interface will not be affected. To avoid data field conflicts when using the old version of the interface, it is recommended that you migrate to the new version of the rule engine interface as soon as possible.
CreateRule.name: Creates a rule in the rule engine (old)

CreateSecurityAPIResource.document: This API is used to create an API resource.
CreateSecurityAPIResource.name: Creates an API resource

CreateSecurityAPIService.document: This API is used to create an API service.
CreateSecurityAPIService.name: Creates an API service

CreateSecurityClientAttester.document: This API is used to create client authentication options.
CreateSecurityClientAttester.name: Creates client authentication options

CreateSecurityIPGroup.document: This API is used to create a security IP group.
CreateSecurityIPGroup.name: Creates a security IP group

CreateSecurityJSInjectionRule.document: This API is used to create a JavaScript injection rule.
CreateSecurityJSInjectionRule.name: Creates a JavaScript injection rule

CreateSharedCNAME.document: This API is used to create a shared CNAME. It is now only available to beta users.
CreateSharedCNAME.name: Creates a shared CNAME.

CreateWebSecurityTemplate.document: This API is used to create a security policy configuration template.
CreateWebSecurityTemplate.name: Creates a security policy configuration template

CreateZone.document:
This API is used to create a site. After you create the site, you can connect it to EdgeOne via the CNAME or NS (see [Quick Start](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/87601?from_cn_redirect=1)), or connect it without a domain name (see [Quick Access to L4 Proxy Service](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/96051?from_cn_redirect=1)).

If there are already EdgeOne plans under the current account, it is recommended to pass in the `PlanId` to bind the site with the plan directly. If `PlanId` is not passed in, the created site is not activated. You need to call [BindZoneToPlan](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/83042?from_cn_redirect=1) to bind the site with a plan. To purchase a plan, please go to the EdgeOne console.
CreateZone.name: Creates a site

DeleteAccelerationDomains.document: This API is used to batch remove accelerated domain names.
DeleteAccelerationDomains.name: Batch remove accelerated domain names

DeleteAliasDomain.document:
This API is used to delete an alias domain name.
The feature is only supported by the enterprise plan and is currently in closed beta testing. If you need to use it, [Contact Us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service?from=connect-us).
DeleteAliasDomain.name: Deletes an alias domain name.

DeleteApplicationProxy.document: This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. For details, see [DeleteL4Proxy] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103415?from_cn_redirect=1).
DeleteApplicationProxy.name: Deletes an application proxy (legacy)

DeleteApplicationProxyRule.document: This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. For details, see [DeleteL4ProxyRules] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103414?from_cn_redirect=1).
DeleteApplicationProxyRule.name: Deletes an application proxy rule (legacy)

DeleteContentIdentifier.document: Delete the specified content identifier. This feature is only available to the allowlist.
DeleteContentIdentifier.name: Delete content identifiers

DeleteCustomErrorPage.document: This API is used to delete a custom response page.
DeleteCustomErrorPage.name: Deletes a custom response page

DeleteDnsRecords.document: You can use this API to batch delete DNS records.
DeleteDnsRecords.name: Batch deletes dns records

DeleteFunction.document: This API is used to delete an edge function. Once deleted, the function cannot be recovered, and associated trigger rules are also deleted.
DeleteFunction.name: Deletes an edge function

DeleteFunctionRules.document: This API is used to delete a trigger rule for an edge function.
DeleteFunctionRules.name: Deletes a trigger rule for an edge function

DeleteJustInTimeTranscodeTemplates.document: This API is used to delete the appropriate just in time transcoding template based on the unique template identifier under the site ID.
DeleteJustInTimeTranscodeTemplates.name: Delete a just-in-time transcoding template

DeleteL4Proxy.document: This API is used to delete a Layer 4 proxy instance.
DeleteL4Proxy.name: Deletes a Layer 4 proxy instance

DeleteL4ProxyRules.document: This API is used to delete Layer 4 proxy forwarding rules, supporting both individual and batch operation.
DeleteL4ProxyRules.name: Deletes Layer 4 proxy forwarding rules

DeleteL7AccRules.document: This API is used to delete rules of the [rule engine](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70901?from_cn_redirect=1), supporting batch deletion.
DeleteL7AccRules.name: Delete layer-7 acceleration rules

DeleteLoadBalancer.document: This API is used to delete a LoadBalancer. If the LoadBalancer is referenced by other services (for example, Layer-4 proxy), the LoadBalancer cannot be deleted until the reference relationship is removed. The load balancing feature is in beta test. If you need to use it, [contact us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service).
DeleteLoadBalancer.name: Deletes a LoadBalancer

DeleteMultiPathGateway.document: This API is used to delete a multi-channel security acceleration gateway, including private gateways and Cloud Gateways.
DeleteMultiPathGateway.name: Delete a multi-channel security acceleration gateway

DeleteMultiPathGatewayLine.document: This API is used to delete lines integrated with the multi-channel security acceleration gateway. Only custom lines support deletion.
DeleteMultiPathGatewayLine.name: Delete a multi-channel security acceleration gateway line

DeleteOriginGroup.document: This API is used to delete an origin group. Note that an origin group can not be deleted if it is referenced by services (e.g. L4 Proxy, domain name service, load balancing, rule engines).
DeleteOriginGroup.name: Deletes an origin group

DeleteRealtimeLogDeliveryTask.document: This API is used to delete a real-time log delivery task.
DeleteRealtimeLogDeliveryTask.name: Deletes a real-time log delivery task

DeleteRules.document: This interface is the old version of the rule engine deletion interface. EdgeOne has fully upgraded the rule engine related interfaces on January 21, 2025. For details on the new version of the seven-layer acceleration rule deletion interface, please refer to [DeleteL7AccRules](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115821?from_cn_redirect=1).<0>Note: Starting from January 21, 2025, the earlier version API will no longer be updated. Subsequent new features will only be provided in the latest version interface. The original capabilities supported by the earlier version API will not be affected. To avoid field conflicts when using the earlier version API, it is recommended that you migrate to the new version rule engine API as soon as possible.</0>.
DeleteRules.name: Batch delete rules from the rule engine (old)

DeleteSecurityAPIResource.document: This API is used to delete API resources.
DeleteSecurityAPIResource.name: Delete an API resource

DeleteSecurityAPIService.document: This API is used to delete the API service.
DeleteSecurityAPIService.name: Delete an API service

DeleteSecurityClientAttester.document: This API is used to delete client authentication options.
DeleteSecurityClientAttester.name: Delete a client authentication option

DeleteSecurityIPGroup.document: This API is used to delete a specified security IP group. Note that the security IP group cannot be deleted if it is referenced in a rule.
DeleteSecurityIPGroup.name: Deletes a security IP group

DeleteSecurityJSInjectionRule.document: This API is used to delete JavaScript injection rules.
DeleteSecurityJSInjectionRule.name: Delete a JavaScript injection rule

DeleteSharedCNAME.document: This API is used to delete a shared CNAME. It is now only available to beta users.
DeleteSharedCNAME.name: Deletes a shared CNAME

DeleteWebSecurityTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a security policy configuration template.
DeleteWebSecurityTemplate.name: Delete a security policy configuration template

DeleteZone.document: This API is used to delete a site.
DeleteZone.name: Deletes a site

DeployConfigGroupVersion.document: This API is used to release versions in version management mode. Users can deploy the version to either the testing environment or the production environment by specifying the EnvId parameter. The version management feature is currently undergoing beta testing and is accessible only to users on the whitelist.
DeployConfigGroupVersion.name: Release Configuration Group Version

DescribeAccelerationDomains.document: This API is used to query domain name information of a site, including the acceleration domain name, origin, and domain name status. You can query the information of all domain names, or specific domain names by specifying filters information.
DescribeAccelerationDomains.name: Queries accelerated domain names

DescribeAliasDomains.document:
This API is used to query the alias domain name information list.
The feature is only supported in the enterprise plan and is currently in closed beta testing. If you need to use it, [Contact Us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service?from=connect-us).
DescribeAliasDomains.name: Queries the information of alias domain names.

DescribeApplicationProxies.document: This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. In the latest version, this API has been split into two APIs: one for querying the Layer 4 proxy instance list and the other for querying Layer 4 forwarding rules. For details, see [DescribeL4Proxy] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103413?from_cn_redirect=1) and [DescribeL4ProxyRules] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103412?from_cn_redirect=1).
DescribeApplicationProxies.name: Queries the application proxy list (legacy)

DescribeAvailablePlans.document: This API is used to query plan options available for purchase.
DescribeAvailablePlans.name: Queries plan options available for purchase

DescribeBillingData.document: This API is used to query billing data.
DescribeBillingData.name: Queries billing data

DescribeConfigGroupVersionDetail.document: This API is used to obtain detailed information about a version in version management mode. The response includes the version ID, description, status, creation time, configuration group information, and the content of the version configuration file. The version management feature is currently undergoing beta testing and is accessible only to users on the whitelist.
DescribeConfigGroupVersionDetail.name: Query Configuration Group Version Details

DescribeConfigGroupVersions.document: This API is used to query the version list for the specified configuration group in version management mode. The version management feature is currently undergoing beta testing and is accessible only to users on the whitelist.
DescribeConfigGroupVersions.name: Query Configuration Group Version List

DescribeContentIdentifiers.document: Batch query content identifiers, which can be filtered by ID, description, status, or Tag. Deleted content identifiers queried by status are retained for only three months. This feature is only open to the allowlist.
DescribeContentIdentifiers.name: Batch query content identifiers

DescribeContentQuota.document: This API is used to query content management quotas.
DescribeContentQuota.name: This API is used to query content management quotas.

DescribeCustomErrorPages.document: This API is used to query the custom response page list.
DescribeCustomErrorPages.name: Queries the custom response page list

DescribeDDoSAttackData.document: This API is used to query the time-series data of DDoS attacks.
DescribeDDoSAttackData.name: Queries the time-series data of DDoS attacks.

DescribeDDoSAttackEvent.document: This API is used to query DDoS attack events.
DescribeDDoSAttackEvent.name: Queries DDoS attack events.

DescribeDDoSAttackTopData.document: This API is used to query the top-ranked DDoS attack data.
DescribeDDoSAttackTopData.name: Queries the top-ranked DDoS attack data.

DescribeDDoSProtection.document: This API is used to search for site exclusive Anti-DDoS information.
DescribeDDoSProtection.name: Query the exclusive DDoS protection info of a site

DescribeDefaultCertificates.document: This API is used to query a list of default certificates.
DescribeDefaultCertificates.name: Queries the list of default certificates

DescribeDeployHistory.document: This API is used to query the release history of versions in the production or test environment in version management mode. The version management feature is currently undergoing beta testing and is accessible only to users on the whitelist.
DescribeDeployHistory.name: Query Version Release History

DescribeDnsRecords.document: This API is used to view DNS record information under a site, including DNS record name, record type, and record content. It supports querying specific DNS record information by specifying filter conditions.
DescribeDnsRecords.name: Query dns record list

DescribeEnvironments.document: This API is used to query environment information in version management mode. The response includes the environment ID, type, and current effective version. The version management feature is currently undergoing beta testing and is accessible only to users on the whitelist.
DescribeEnvironments.name: Query Environment Information

DescribeFunctionRules.document: This API is used to query the list of trigger rules for an edge function. It supports filtering by rule ID, function ID, rule description, and so on.
DescribeFunctionRules.name: Queries a trigger rule for an edge function

DescribeFunctionRuntimeEnvironment.document: This API is used to query the runtime environment of an edge function, including environment variables.
DescribeFunctionRuntimeEnvironment.name: Queries the runtime environment of an edge function

DescribeFunctions.document: This API is used to query the list of edge functions. It supports filtering by function ID, name, description, and so on.
DescribeFunctions.name: Queries the list of trigger rules

DescribeHostsSetting.document: This API is an old version. EdgeOne has fully upgraded the APIs related to the rule engine. You can obtain detailed configurations of domain names through [DescribeL7AccSetting](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115819?from_cn_redirect=1) and [DescribeL7AccRules](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115820?from_cn_redirect=1).
DescribeHostsSetting.name: Query detailed configurations of the domain name (old)

DescribeIPRegion.document: This API is used to check if the IP is an EdgeOne IP.
DescribeIPRegion.name: Queries IP location information

DescribeIdentifications.document: This API is used to query the verification information of a site.
DescribeIdentifications.name: Queries the verification information of a site.

DescribeJustInTimeTranscodeTemplates.document: This API is used to search the transcoding template detail list according to the name, template type, or unique identifier of the just-in-time transcoding template. The returned results include all eligible custom templates and preset templates.
DescribeJustInTimeTranscodeTemplates.name: Search just-in-time transcoding template list

DescribeL4Proxy.document: This API is used to query a Layer 4 proxy instance list.
DescribeL4Proxy.name: Queries a Layer 4 proxy instance list

DescribeL4ProxyRules.document: This API is used to query the forwarding rule list under a Layer 4 proxy instance.
DescribeL4ProxyRules.name: Queries a Layer 4 proxy forwarding rule list

DescribeL7AccRules.document: This API is used to query the rule list of the rule engine (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70901?from_cn_redirect=1).
DescribeL7AccRules.name: Query layer-7 acceleration rules

DescribeL7AccSetting.document: This API is used to query the global configuration of [Site Acceleration](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/96193?from_cn_redirect=1).
DescribeL7AccSetting.name: Query global configurations of layer-7 acceleration

DescribeLoadBalancerList.document: This API is used to query the LoadBalancer list. The load balancing feature is in beta test. If you need to use it, [contact us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service).
DescribeLoadBalancerList.name: Queries the LoadBalancer list

DescribeMultiPathGateway.document: This API is used to query multi-channel security acceleration gateway details such as name, Gateway ID, IP, port and type.
DescribeMultiPathGateway.name: Query multi-channel security acceleration gateway details

DescribeMultiPathGatewayLine.document: Use this API to query the lines integrated with the multi-channel security acceleration gateway, including direct connection lines, EdgeOne Layer-4 proxy lines, and custom lines.
DescribeMultiPathGatewayLine.name: Query multi-channel security acceleration gateway lines details

DescribeMultiPathGatewayRegions.document: This API is used to query the list of available regions for user-created multi-channel security acceleration gateways (Cloud Gateway).
DescribeMultiPathGatewayRegions.name: Query the list of available regions for the multi-channel security acceleration gateway

DescribeMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.document: This API is used to query keys for integrating multi-channel security acceleration gateways. Customers access multi-channel security acceleration gateways based on key signature.
DescribeMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.name: Query the access key for the multi-channel security acceleration gateway

DescribeMultiPathGateways.document: Query the multi-channel security acceleration gateway list created by the user through this interface. Supports pagination.
DescribeMultiPathGateways.name: Query multi-channel security acceleration gateway list

DescribeOriginACL.document: This API is used to query the binding relationship between L7 acceleration domains/L4 proxy instances and origin ACLs under a site, as well as IP range details. If you want to periodically obtain the latest version of origin IP ranges through an automation script, you can poll this API at a low-frequency (recommended every three days). If the NextOriginACL field has a return value, synchronize the latest origin IP ranges to the origin server firewall configuration.
DescribeOriginACL.name: Query Origin Protection Detail

DescribeOriginGroup.document: This API is used to obtain a list of origin groups.
DescribeOriginGroup.name: Obtains a list of origin groups.

DescribeOriginGroupHealthStatus.document: This API is used to query the health status of origin server groups under a LoadBalancer. The load balancing feature is in beta test. If you need to use it, [contact us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service).
DescribeOriginGroupHealthStatus.name: Queries the health status of origin server groups under a LoadBalancer

DescribeOriginProtection.document:
This API is used to query origin protection on an earlier version. EdgeOne comprehensively upgraded relevant APIs for origin protection on June 27, 2025. For details on the new version, see [DescribeOriginACL](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/120408?from_cn_redirect=1).

Note: Starting from June 27, 2025, the legacy version APIs will stop updating. New features will only be provided in the latest version APIs. To avoid data field conflicts when using legacy version APIs, it is recommended to migrate to the new version origin protection APIs as soon as possible.
DescribeOriginProtection.name: Query origin protection info (legacy)

DescribeOverviewL7Data.document: This API is used to query the time sequence traffic data of the monitoring category in L7. This API is to be discarded. Please use the API DescribeTimingL7AnalysisData.
DescribeOverviewL7Data.name: Query monitoring traffic time sequence data (to be discarded)

DescribePlans.document: This API is used to query package information list with pagination support.
DescribePlans.name: Query package information list

DescribePrefetchTasks.document: DescribePrefetchTasks is used to query the submission history and execution progress of preheating tasks. This interface can be used to query the tasks submitted by the CreatePrefetchTasks interface.
DescribePrefetchTasks.name: This API is used to query the pre-warming task status.

DescribePurgeTasks.document: DescribePurgeTasks is used to query the submitted URL refreshing and directory refreshing records and execution progress. This interface can be used to query the tasks submitted by the CreatePurgeTasks API.
DescribePurgeTasks.name: Querying the cache purging history

DescribeRealtimeLogDeliveryTasks.document: This API is used to query the real-time log delivery task list.
DescribeRealtimeLogDeliveryTasks.name: Queries the list of real-time log delivery tasks

DescribeRules.document:
This API is on an earlier version to query engine rules. EdgeOne has comprehensively upgraded relevant APIs of the rule engine on January 21, 2025. For details about the new version API to query layer-7 acceleration rules, see DescribeL7AccRules(https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115820?from_cn_redirect=1).

Note: Starting from January 21, 2025, the old version of the interface will stop updating and iteration. Subsequent new features will only be provided in the new version of the interface, and the original capabilities supported by the old version of the interface will not be affected. To avoid data field conflicts when using the old version of the interface, it is recommended that you migrate to the new version of the rule engine interface as soon as possible.
DescribeRules.name: Query the rules in the rule engine (old)

DescribeRulesSetting.document: This API is an older version. EdgeOne has fully upgraded the APIs related to the rule engine. For details, please refer to [RuleEngineAction](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/80721?from_cn_redirect=1#RuleEngineAction).
DescribeRulesSetting.name: Query the setting parameters of the rule engine (old)

DescribeSecurityAPIResource.document: This API is used to query API resources under a site.
DescribeSecurityAPIResource.name: Query API resources

DescribeSecurityAPIService.document: This API is used to query API services under a site.
DescribeSecurityAPIService.name: Query API service

DescribeSecurityClientAttester.document: This API is used to query client authentication option configuration.
DescribeSecurityClientAttester.name: Queries client authentication options

DescribeSecurityIPGroup.document: This API is used to query the configuration information of a security IP group, including the ID, name and content of the security IP group. The query result of this API only returns up to 2000 IPs or CIDR blocks for each IP group. If there is a very large IP group exceeding 2000 IPs or CIDR blocks, call DescribeSecurityIPGroupContent to perform a paging query.
DescribeSecurityIPGroup.name: Queries security IP groups

DescribeSecurityIPGroupContent.document: This API is used to perform a paging query for the IP address list in a designated IP group. When the number of IP addresses in the group exceeds 2000, you can use this API to perform a paging query to obtain the complete IP address list.
DescribeSecurityIPGroupContent.name: Queries the IP list in an IP group with paging

DescribeSecurityIPGroupInfo.name: Queries security IP groups (deprecated)

DescribeSecurityJSInjectionRule.document: This API is used to query JavaScript injection rules.
DescribeSecurityJSInjectionRule.name: Query JavaScript injection rules

DescribeSecurityPolicy.document: This API is used to query the web and security protection configurations.
DescribeSecurityPolicy.name: Query security protection configuration details

DescribeSecurityTemplateBindings.document: This API is used to query bindings of a policy template.
DescribeSecurityTemplateBindings.name: Queries bindings of a policy template

DescribeTimingL4Data.document: This API is used to query the list of L4 traffic data recorded over time.
DescribeTimingL4Data.name: Queries the L4 traffic data over time

DescribeTimingL7AnalysisData.document: This API is used to query the time series data of the L7 domain name. Note that there is a delay of about 10 minutes for this API. It is recommended to pull data from 10 minutes before the current time.
DescribeTimingL7AnalysisData.name: Queries the traffic analysis data over time

DescribeTimingL7CacheData.document: This API is used to query the time series traffic data of the L7 cache analysis. It will be deprecated. Use the DescribeTimingL7AnalysisData API instead.
DescribeTimingL7CacheData.name: Queries the time series data of the cache analysis (to be deprecated)

DescribeTopL7AnalysisData.document: This API is used to query the top N data of the L7 domain name by a specified dimension. Note that there is a delay of about 10 minutes for this API. It is recommended to pull data from 10 minutes before the current time.
DescribeTopL7AnalysisData.name: Queries the traffic analysis data

DescribeTopL7CacheData.document: This API is used to query the top N data of the L7 cache analysis. It will be deprecated. Use the DescribeTopL7AnalysisData API instead.
DescribeTopL7CacheData.name: Queries the top N data of the cache analysis (to be deprecated)

DescribeWebSecurityTemplate.document: This API is used to query security policy configuration template details.
DescribeWebSecurityTemplate.name: Query security policy configuration template detail

DescribeWebSecurityTemplates.document: This API is used to query the security policy configuration template list.
DescribeWebSecurityTemplates.name: Query security policy configuration template list

DescribeZoneConfigImportResult.document: This API is used to query the results of site configuration import via API (ImportZoneConfig). This feature only supports the sites in the plans of the Standard Edition and the Enterprise Edition.
DescribeZoneConfigImportResult.name: Queries site configuration import results

DescribeZoneSetting.document: This API is an old version. EdgeOne has fully upgraded the APIs related to the rule engine. For details, please refer to [DescribeL7AccSetting](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115819?from_cn_redirect=1).
DescribeZoneSetting.name: Query zone configuration (old)

DescribeZones.document: This API is used to query the information of sites that you have access to. You can filter sites based on different query criteria.
DescribeZones.name: Queries the list of sites

DestroyPlan.document:
To stop billing for your EdgeOne plan, you can use this interface to terminate the billing plan.
> Terminating a billing plan requires the following conditions:
    1. The plan has expired (except for the Enterprise Edition Plan);
    2. All sites under the plan have been either shut down or deleted.

> The site status can be queried through the [Query Site List](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/80713?from_cn_redirect=1) interface.
A site can be deactivated by switching the site to a closed status through the [Switch Site Status](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/80707?from_cn_redirect=1) interface.
A site can be deleted by using the [Delete Site](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/80717?from_cn_redirect=1) interface.
DestroyPlan.name: Terminates plan

DisableOriginACL.document: This API is used to disable 'Origin Protection' of a site. Once disabled, resources related to it will no longer use only the origin ACLs provided by "origin protection" to request your origin, and stops sending update notifications on the origin ACLs.
DisableOriginACL.name: Disable Origin Protection

DownloadL4Logs.document: This API is used to download L4 logs.
DownloadL4Logs.name: Downloads L4 logs

DownloadL7Logs.document: This API is used to download L7 logs.
DownloadL7Logs.name: Downloads L7 logs.

EnableOriginACL.document:
This API is used to enable origin protection for a site for the first time. Enabled, EdgeOne will use specific origin IP ranges to backhaul traffic for L7 acceleration domains/L4 proxy instances. The maximum allowed number of L7 acceleration domains per submission is 200, and the maximum allowed number of L4 proxy instances is 100. Mixing L7 acceleration domains and L4 proxy instances in a single submission is supported, with a total maximum of 200 instances. To enable more than 200 resources, first enable the maximum quantity via specified resources, then enable the remaining resources via the ModifyOriginACL API. Subsequent addition of L7 acceleration domains/L4 proxy instances should be configured via the ModifyOriginACL API.

Create and bind policy Query instance Reset instance access password.
-Call this API to deem as consent to the origin protection enablement special agreement (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/120141?from_cn_redirect=1);.
-The origin IP range may change irregularly. tencent cloud EdgeOne (EdgeOne) will trigger notifications via message Center, SMS, or email 14 days, 7 days, 3 days, and 1 day before the change. To ensure you receive the change notification for the origin IP range, please ensure you have selected EdgeOne product services in the [tencent cloud message Center console](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/message) and configured the correct message recipient. For the setting method, refer to [message Subscription Management](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/567/43476?from_cn_redirect=1).
EnableOriginACL.name: Enable origin protection

ExportZoneConfig.document: This API is used to export site configuration . The exported configuration is used for import via the API (ImportZoneConfig). This feature only supports the sites in the plans of the Standard Edition and the Enterprise Edition.
ExportZoneConfig.name: Exports site configuration

HandleFunctionRuntimeEnvironment.document:
This API is used to operate the runtime environment of an edge function. It supports related settings for environment variables.
After the environment variables are set, they can be used in the function code. For details, see [Edge Functions Referencing Environment Variables](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/109151?from_cn_redirect=1#0151fd9a-8b0e-407b-ae37-54553a60ded6).
HandleFunctionRuntimeEnvironment.name: Operates the runtime environment of an edge function

IdentifyZone.document: This API is used to verify ownership of the site.
IdentifyZone.name: Verifies site ownership

ImportZoneConfig.document: This API is used to quickly import site configuration files. After the import is initiated, the API will return the corresponding task ID (TaskId). Users need to use the site configuration import result query API (DescribeZoneConfigImportResult) to obtain the results of this import task. This feature only supports the sites in the plans of the Standard Edition and the Enterprise Edition.
ImportZoneConfig.name: Imports site configuration

IncreasePlanQuota.document:
When the number of sites bound to your plan, the number of rules under "Web Protection - Custom Rules - Precision Matching Policy", or the number of rules under "Web Protection - Rate Limiting - Precision Rate Limiting Module" reaches the plan's quota, you can use this interface to purchase additional quotas.
> This interface only supports the Enterprise Edition Plan.
IncreasePlanQuota.name: Purchases additional plan quota

ModifyAccelerationDomain.document: This API is used to modify an accelerated domain name.
ModifyAccelerationDomain.name: Modifies an accelerated domain name

ModifyAccelerationDomainStatuses.document: This API is used to batch modify the status of accelerated domains.
ModifyAccelerationDomainStatuses.name: Batch modifies the status of accelerated domains.

ModifyAliasDomain.document:
This API is used to modify an alias domain name.
The feature is only supported in the enterprise plan and is currently in closed beta testing. If you need to use it, [contact us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service?from=connect-us).
ModifyAliasDomain.name: Modifies an alias domain name.

ModifyAliasDomainStatus.document:
This API is used to modify the status of an alias domain name.
The feature is only supported in the enterprise plan and is currently in closed beta testing. If you need to use it, [Contact Us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service?from=connect-us).
ModifyAliasDomainStatus.name: Modifies the status of an alias domain name.

ModifyApplicationProxy.document:
This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. For details, see [ModifyL4Proxy
] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103411?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyApplicationProxy.name: Modifies an application proxy (legacy)

ModifyApplicationProxyRule.document: This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. For details, see [ModifyL4ProxyRules] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103410?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyApplicationProxyRule.name: Modifies an application proxy rule (legacy)

ModifyApplicationProxyRuleStatus.document:
This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. For details, see [ModifyL4ProxyRulesStatus
] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103409?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyApplicationProxyRuleStatus.name: Modifies the status of an application proxy rule (legacy)

ModifyApplicationProxyStatus.document: This API is on an earlier version. If you want to call it, please switch to the latest version. For details, see [ModifyL4ProxyStatus] (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/103408?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyApplicationProxyStatus.name: Modifies the application proxy status (legacy)

ModifyContentIdentifier.document: Modify content identifier, only description modification is supported. This feature is only open to the allowlist.
ModifyContentIdentifier.name: Modify content identifier

ModifyCustomErrorPage.document: This API is used to modify a custom response page.
ModifyCustomErrorPage.name: Modifies a custom response page

ModifyDDoSProtection.document: This API is used to modify site exclusive Anti-DDoS protection.
ModifyDDoSProtection.name: Modify site exclusive Anti-DDoS protection

ModifyDnsRecords.document: This API is used to bulk modify DNS records.
ModifyDnsRecords.name: Batch modify dns records

ModifyDnsRecordsStatus.document: You can batch modify the status of DNS records through this API, enabling and disabling records in bulk.
ModifyDnsRecordsStatus.name: Batch modify dns record status

ModifyFunction.document: This API is used to modify an edge function. It supports modifying the function content and description. The function will take effect immediately after modification and redeployment.
ModifyFunction.name: Modifies an edge function

ModifyFunctionRule.document: This API is used to modify a trigger rule for an edge function. It supports modifying rule conditions, execution functions, and description.
ModifyFunctionRule.name: Modifies a trigger rule for an edge function

ModifyFunctionRulePriority.document: This API is used to modify the priority of trigger rules for an edge function.
ModifyFunctionRulePriority.name: Modifies the priority of trigger rules for an edge function

ModifyHostsCertificate.document:
This API is used to configure the certificate of a site. You can use your own certificate or [apply for a free certificate](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/90437?from_cn_redirect=1).
To use an external certificate, upload the certificate to [SSL Certificates Console](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/certoview) first, and then input the certificate ID in this API. For details, see [Deploying Own Certificates to EdgeOne Domains](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/88874?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyHostsCertificate.name: Configures the certificate

ModifyL4Proxy.document: This API is used to modify the configuration of a Layer 4 proxy instance.
ModifyL4Proxy.name: Modifies a Layer 4 proxy instance

ModifyL4ProxyRules.document: This API is used to modify Layer 4 proxy forwarding rules, supporting both individual and batch modification.
ModifyL4ProxyRules.name: Modifies Layer 4 proxy forwarding rules

ModifyL4ProxyRulesStatus.document: This API is used to start or stop Layer 4 proxy forwarding rules, supporting both individual and batch operation.
ModifyL4ProxyRulesStatus.name: Modifies Layer 4 proxy forwarding rule status

ModifyL4ProxyStatus.document: This API is used to enable or disable a Layer 4 proxy instance.
ModifyL4ProxyStatus.name: Modifies Layer 4 proxy instance status

ModifyL7AccRule.document: This API is used to modify rules in the [rule engine](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70901?from_cn_redirect=1), supporting only one rule modification per request.
ModifyL7AccRule.name: Modify layer-7 acceleration rules

ModifyL7AccRulePriority.document: This interface is used to modify the priority of the rule list in the [Rule Engine](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70901?from_cn_redirect=1). This interface requires the complete rule ID list under the site ID to be passed in. The rule ID list can be obtained through the [Query Seven-Layer Acceleration Rules](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115820?from_cn_redirect=1) interface. The final priority order will be adjusted to the order of the rule ID list, and will be executed from front to back.
ModifyL7AccRulePriority.name: Modify the rule priority of layer-7 acceleration

ModifyL7AccSetting.document: This API is used to modify the global configuration of [Site Acceleration](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/96193?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyL7AccSetting.name: Modify global configurations of layer-7 acceleration

ModifyLoadBalancer.document: This API is used to modify LoadBalancer configuration. The load balancing feature is in beta test. If you need to use it, [contact us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service).
ModifyLoadBalancer.name: Modifies a LoadBalancer

ModifyMultiPathGateway.document: This API is used to modify multi-channel security acceleration gateway information, such as name, gateway ID, IP and port.
ModifyMultiPathGateway.name: Modify the multi-channel security acceleration gateway information

ModifyMultiPathGatewayLine.document: This API is used to modify the access lines of the multi-channel security acceleration gateway, including EdgeOne Layer-4 proxy lines and custom lines.
ModifyMultiPathGatewayLine.name: Modify multi-channel security acceleration gateway line information

ModifyMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.document: This API is used to modify the access key for the multi-channel security acceleration gateway.The access key is used by customers to sign requests for gateway access. The original key becomes invalid after modification.
ModifyMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.name: Modify a multi-channel security acceleration gateway integration key

ModifyOriginACL.document: This API is used to enable or disable specific origin ACLs for L7 acceleration domain names or L4 proxy instances. A single submission supports up to 200 L7 acceleration domain names or 100 L4 proxy instances. Hybrid submissions of L7 acceleration domain names and L4 proxy instances are supported, with a maximum total number of instances of 200. If changes are needed for exceeding 200 instances, submit them in batches via this API.
ModifyOriginACL.name: Modify Origin Protection Instances

ModifyOriginGroup.document: This API is used to modify the configuration of an origin group. The original configuration will be overwritten.
ModifyOriginGroup.name: Modifies an origin group

ModifyPlan.document: Modify the plan settings. Currently, only the auto-renewal switch of prepaid plans can be modified.
ModifyPlan.name: Modifies plan setting

ModifyRealtimeLogDeliveryTask.document:
This API is used to modify the real-time log delivery task configuration. This API has the following restrictions:
  • Does not support modifying the destination type of the real-time log delivery task (TaskType);
  • Does not support modifying the data delivery type (LogType);
  • Does not support modifying the data delivery area (Area);
  • Does not support modifying the detailed destination configuration, such as log set and log topic, when the destination of the original real-time log delivery task is Tencent Cloud CLS.
ModifyRealtimeLogDeliveryTask.name: Modifies a real-time log delivery task

ModifyRule.document:
This API is on an earlier version. EdgeOne has comprehensively upgraded the relevant APIs of the rule engine on January 21, 2025. For details about the new version of the API for modifying layer-7 acceleration rules, see ModifyL7AccRule(https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115818?from_cn_redirect=1).

Note: Starting from January 21, 2025, the old version of the interface will stop updating and iteration. Subsequent new features will only be provided in the new version of the interface, and the original capabilities supported by the old version of the interface will not be affected. To avoid data field conflicts when using the old version of the interface, it is recommended that you migrate to the new version of the rule engine interface as soon as possible.
ModifyRule.name: Modify a rule in the rule engine (old)

ModifySecurityAPIResource.document: This API is used to modify an API resource.
ModifySecurityAPIResource.name: Modify an API resource

ModifySecurityAPIService.document: This API is used to modify an API service.
ModifySecurityAPIService.name: Modify an API service

ModifySecurityClientAttester.document: This API is used to modify client authentication options.
ModifySecurityClientAttester.name: Modify client authentication options

ModifySecurityIPGroup.document: This API is used to modify a security IP group.
ModifySecurityIPGroup.name: Modifies a security IP group

ModifySecurityJSInjectionRule.document: This API is used to modify JavaScript injection rules.
ModifySecurityJSInjectionRule.name: Modify JavaScript injection rules

ModifySecurityPolicy.document: This API is used to modify the web and bot security configurations.
ModifySecurityPolicy.name: Modifies the web and bot security configurations

ModifyWebSecurityTemplate.document: This API is used to modify the security policy configuration template.
ModifyWebSecurityTemplate.name: Modify a security policy configuration template

ModifyZone.document: This API is used to modify a site.
ModifyZone.name: Modifies a site.

ModifyZoneSetting.document: This API is an older version. EdgeOne has fully upgraded the APIs related to the rule engine. For details, please refer to [ModifyL7AccSetting](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/115817?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyZoneSetting.name: Modify site configuration (old)

ModifyZoneStatus.document: This API is used to change the site status.
ModifyZoneStatus.name: Changes the site status

RefreshMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.document: This API is used to refresh keys for multi-channel security acceleration gateways. Customers access multi-channel security acceleration gateways based on integration key signatures. Each site has only one access key, which applies to all gateways under that site. After refreshing the key, the original key becomes invalid.
RefreshMultiPathGatewaySecretKey.name: Refresh the access key for the multi-channel security acceleration gateway

RenewPlan.document:
When your plan needs to be extended, you can use this interface to renew it. Plan renewal is only supported for the Personal, Basic, and Standard Editions.
> For cost details, refer to [Plan Fees](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/94158?from_cn_redirect=1).
RenewPlan.name: Renews plan

UpgradePlan.document:
When you need features available only in higher-tier plans, you can upgrade your plan through this interface. Upgrades are only supported for Personal and Basic Edition Plans.
> For differences between EdgeOne billing plans, refer to [Comparison of EdgeOne Plans](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/94165?from_cn_redirect=1).
For EdgeOne plan upgrade rules and pricing details, refer to [EdgeOne Plan Upgrade Guide](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/95291?from_cn_redirect=1).
If your plan needs to upgrade to the Enterprise Edition, [Contact Us](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/online?from_cn_redirect=1-service).
UpgradePlan.name: Upgrades plan

VerifyOwnership.document:
This API is used to verify your ownership of a site or domain name. It's required in the CNAME access mode. After a site is verified, you don't need to verify the ownership again for domain names added to it in the future. For details, see [Ownership Verification](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70789?from_cn_redirect=1).

For sites connected via the NS, you can query whether the NS is successfully switched through this API. For details, see [Modifying DNS Servers](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/90452?from_cn_redirect=1).
VerifyOwnership.name: Verifies ownership

members.document: DNS record name. if the domain name is in chinese, korean, or japanese, it needs to be converted to punycode before input.
members.name: Name

members.document:
DNS record type. valid values are:
  • a: points the domain name to an external ipv4 address, such as 8.8.8.8;
  • aaaa: points the domain name to an external ipv6 address;
  • mx: used for email servers. when there are multiple mx records, the lower the priority value, the higher the priority;
  • cname: points the domain name to another domain name, which then resolves to the final ip address;
  • txt: identifies and describes the domain name, commonly used for domain verification and spf records (anti-spam);
  • ns: if you need to delegate the subdomain to another dns service provider for resolution, you need to add an ns record. the root domain cannot add ns records;
  • caa: specifies the ca that can issue certificates for this site;
  • srv: identifies a server using a service, commonly used in microsoft's directory management.
    • . Different record types, such as srv and caa records, have different requirements for host record names and record value formats. for detailed descriptions and format examples of each record type, please refer to: [introduction to dns record types](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/90453?from_cn_redirect=1#2f681022-91ab-4a9e-ac3d-0a6c454d954e).
members.name: Type

members.document: DNS record content. fill in the corresponding content according to the type value. if the domain name is in chinese, korean, or japanese, it needs to be converted to punycode before input.
members.name: Content

members.document:
DNS record resolution route. if not specified, the default is default, which means the default resolution route and is effective in all regions.

- resolution route configuration is only applicable when type (dns record type) is a, aaaa, or cname.
- resolution route configuration is only applicable to standard version and enterprise edition packages. for valid values, please refer to: [resolution routes and corresponding code enumeration](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/112542?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Location

members.document: Cache time. users can specify a value range of 60-86400. the smaller the value, the faster the modification records will take effect in all regions. default value: 300. unit: seconds.
members.name: TTL

members.document:
DNS record weight. users can specify a value range of -1 to 100. a value of 0 means no resolution. if not specified, the default is -1, which means no weight is set. weight configuration is only applicable when type (dns record type) is a, aaaa, or cname.
note: for the same subdomain, different dns records with the same resolution route should either all have weights set or none have weights set.
members.name: Weight

members.document: MX record priority, which takes effect only when type (dns record type) is mx. the smaller the value, the higher the priority. users can specify a value range of 0–50. the default value is 0 if not specified.
members.name: Priority

members.document: DNS record id.

LoadBalancer type. Valid values:
  • HTTP: HTTP-specific LoadBalancer. It supports adding HTTP-specific and general origin server groups. It can only be referenced by site acceleration services (such as domain name service and rule engine).
  • GENERAL: general LoadBalancer. It only supports adding general origin server groups. It can be referenced by site acceleration services (such as domain name service and rule engine) and Layer-4 proxy.

Traffic scheduling policy among origin server groups. Valid values:
  • Priority: Perform failover according to priority.
    • The default value is Priority.
members.name: SteeringPolicy

members.document:
Request retry policy when access to an origin server fails. For details, refer to [Introduction to Request Retry Strategy](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/104227?from_cn_redirect=1). Valid values:
  • OtherOriginGroup: After a single request fails, retry with another origin server within the next lower priority origin server group.
  • OtherRecordInOriginGroup: After a single request fails, retry with another origin server within the same origin server group.
    • The default value is OtherRecordInOriginGroup.

  • `sta_cm`: Standard plan that supports content delivery network inside the Chinese mainland.
  • `sta_cm_with_bot`: Standard plan that supports content delivery network inside the Chinese mainland and bot management.
  • `sta_global`: Standard plan that supports content delivery network over the globe.
  • `sta_global_with_bot`: Standard plan that supports content delivery network over the globe and bot management.
  • `ent`: Enterprise plan that supports content delivery network outside the Chinese mainland.
  • `ent_with_bot`: Enterprise plan that supports content delivery network outside the Chinese mainland and bot management.
  • `ent_cm`: Enterprise plan that supports content delivery network inside the Chinese mainland.
  • `ent_cm_with_bot`: Enterprise plan that supports content delivery network inside the Chinese mainland and bot management.
  • `ent_global`: Enterprise plan that supports content delivery network over the globe.

members.document:
Media fragment preheating control. valid values:.
  • On: enables shard preheating, preheats the description file, and performs recursive resolution of the description file shards for preheating.
    • .
  • Off: only preheat the submitted description file.
    • default value: off if left empty. Notes:. 1. the supported description file is M3U8, and the corresponding shard is TS. Describes the requirement that the description file can process normal requests and specify the sharding path as per industry standards. Recursive resolution depth is no more than 3. Parsed shards normally accumulate daily pre-warming amount. when usage exceeds the quota limit, silent processing is triggered and preheating is no longer executed. This parameter specifies the allowlist feature. if necessary, contact tencent cloud engineers.

members.document: The list of custom fields for log delivery, which supports extracting specified content from HTTP request headers, response headers, cookies, and request bodies. Custom field names must be unique. The number of custom fields cannot exceed a maximum of 200. A single real-time log delivery task can configure up to 5 custom fields of the request body type. Currently, only site acceleration logs (`LogType`=`domain`) support custom fields.
members.name: CustomFields

members.document: Filter criteria of log delivery. If this parameter is not specified, all logs will be delivered.

members.document: Sampling ratio in permille. Value range: 1-1000. For example, 605 indicates a sampling ratio of 60.5%. If this parameter is not specified, the sampling ratio is 100%.
members.name: Sample

members.document:
Output format for log delivery. If this field is not specified, the default format is used, which works as follows:
  • When `TaskType` is `custom_endpoint`, the default format is an array of JSON objects, with each JSON object representing a log entry;
  • When `TaskType` is `s3`, the default format is JSON Lines;
    • Specifically, when `TaskType` is `cls`, the only allowed value for `LogFormat.FormatType` is `json`, and other parameters in `LogFormat` will be ignored. It is recommended not to input `LogFormat`.
members.name: LogFormat

members.document:
Shared CNAME prefix. Enter a valid domain name prefix, such as "test-api" and "test-api.com". A maximum of 50 characters are allowed. 

Complete format of the shared CNAME: '<Custom prefix>+<A 12-character random string in ZoneId>+share.dnse[0-5].com'. 

For example, if the prefix is example.com, EdgeOne will create the shared CNAME: example.com.sai2ig51kaa5.share.dnse2.com.
members.name: SharedCNAMEPrefix

members.document: Description. It supports 1-50 characters.
members.example: 用于业务 A 场景
members.name: Description

members.document:
Site access type. If this parameter is not input, the default value `partial` is used. Valid values of this parameter are as follows:
  • partial: CNAME access;
  • full: NS access;
  • noDomainAccess: access with no domain name.
  • dnsPodAccess: DNSPod hosted access. To use this access mode, your domain name should have been hosted on DNSPod.
members.name: Type

members.document: Site name. For sites connected via CNAME/NS, pass in the secondary domain name (example.com). Leave it blank if the site is connected without a domain name.
members.name: ZoneName

members.document:
The acceleration area of the L7 domain name when `Type` is `partial` or `full`. When Type is `noDomainAccess`, please leave it blank.
  • `global`: Global AZs
  • `mainland`: AZs in the Chinese mainland
  • `overseas`: (Default) AZs outside the Chinese mainland
members.name: Area

members.document:
Target package ID to bind. when a package already exists under your account, you can fill in this parameter to directly bind the site to the package. if there are currently no bindable packages, you can purchase a package via [CreatePlan](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/105771?from_cn_redirect=1).
Note: if this parameter is not specified, a site in "init" status will be created. the site is inactive and will not be displayed in the console. you can bind a package and activate the site through [BindZoneToPlan](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/83042?from_cn_redirect=1). after activation, the site can provide service properly.
members.name: PlanId

members.document: Identical site identifier. limits input to numbers, english letters, ".", "-", and "_", with a character limit of 200 characters. for details, see identical site identifier (https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70202?from_cn_redirect=1). leave this field blank if this usage scenario does not apply.
members.name: AliasZoneName

members.document: Tags of the site. To create tags, go to the [Tag Console](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/tag/taglist).
members.name: Tags

members.document:
Whether to allow duplicate sites. Values:
  • `true`: Duplicate sites are allowed.
  • `false`: Duplicate sites are not allowed.
    • If it is left empty, the default value `false` is used.
members.name: AllowDuplicates

members.document: Whether to skip scanning the existing DNS records of the site. Default value: false.
members.name: JumpStart

members.document: Site ID.
members.name: ZoneId

members.document:
Site ownership verification information. After the site is created, you need to complete the ownership verification before the site can serve normally.

If `Type=partial`, add TXT records to your DNS provider or add files to the root DNS server, and then call [VerifyOwnership]() to complete verification. For more information, see [Ownership Verification](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/70789?from_cn_redirect=1).

If `Type = full`, switch the DNS server as instructed by [Modifying DNS Server](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/90452?from_cn_redirect=1). Then call [VerifyOwnership]() to check the result.

If `Type = noDomainAccess`, leave it blank. No action is required.
Note: This field may return·null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OwnershipVerification

members.document:
This parameter is used to record whether "I've upgraded to the lastest verison" is completed before the origin ACLs version is effective. valid values:.
- true: specifies that the version is effective and the update to the latest version is confirmed.
- false: when the version takes effect, the confirmation of updating to the latest origin ACLs are not completed. The IP range is forcibly updated to the latest version in the backend. When this parameter returns false, please confirm in time whether your origin server firewall configuration has been updated to the latest version to avoid origin-pull failure.
Note: This field may return null, which indicates a failure to obtain a valid value.
members.name: IsPlaned

For a header carried by default in EdgeOne log pushing, such as Content-Type, the header value you input will overwrite the default value. The header value references a single variable ${batchSize} to obtain the number of log entries included in each POST request.

CustomField.document: The custom log field in a real-time log delivery task.

members.document:
Type of the custom log field, which indicates extracting data from specified positions in HTTP requests and responses. valid values:.
  • ReqHeader: extract the value of a specified field from an HTTP request header;
    • .
  • RspHeader: extracts the value of a specified field from an HTTP response header.
    • .
  • Cookie: extract the specified field value from a cookie;
    • .
  • ReqBody: extract specified content from an HTTP request body using a Google RE2 regular expression.
    • .
members.name: Name

members.document:
Enter the field value definition based on the field type (Name). this parameter is case-sensitive.
  • When the field type is ReqHeader, RspHeader, or Cookie, enter the parameter name for value extraction, such as Accept-Language. you can enter 1-100 characters. the name must start with a letter, contain letters, digits, or hyphens (-) in the middle, and end with a letter or digit.
    • .
  • When the field type is ReqBody, enter the Google RE2 regular expression. the maximum length of the regular expression is 4 KB.
    • .
members.name: Value

members.document: Whether to deliver this field. leave blank to skip delivery.
members.name: Enabled

members.document: The custom rule name.
members.name: Name

members.document: The specifics of the custom rule, must comply with the expression grammar, please refer to product documentation for details.
members.name: Condition

members.document:
Action for custom rules. The Name parameter of SecurityAction supports:
  • `Deny`: block;
  • `Monitor`: observe;
  • `ReturnCustomPage`: block with customized page;
  • `Redirect`: Redirect to URL;
  • `BlockIP`: IP blocking;
  • `JSChallenge`: JavaScript challenge;
  • `ManagedChallenge`: managed challenge;
  • `Allow`: Allow.
    • .
members.name: Action

members.document:
The custom rule status. Values:
  • `on`: enabled
  • `off`: disabled
    • .
members.name: Enabled

members.document:
Custom rule ID.
Different rule configuration operations are supported by rule ID :
- Add a new rule: ID is empty or the ID parameter is not specified;
- Modify an existing rule: specify the rule ID that needs to be updated/modified;
- Delete an existing rule: existing rules not included in the Rules parameter will be deleted.
members.name: Id

members.document:
Type of custom rule. Values:
  • `BasicAccessRule`: basic access control;
  • `PreciseMatchRule`: exact custom rule, default;
  • `ManagedAccessRule`: expert customized rule, output parameter only.
    • The default value is PreciseMatchRule.
members.name: RuleType

members.document: Customize the priority of custom rule. Range: 0-100, the default value is 0, this parameter only supports PreciseMatchRule.
members.name: Priority

members.document:
The custom rule.
when modifying the Web protection configuration using ModifySecurityPolicy:
- if the Rules parameter is not specified or the parameter length of Rules is zero: clear all custom rule configurations.
- if the Rules parameter is not specified: keep the existing custom rule configuration without modification.
members.name: Rules

members.document:
Specifies the protection scope of standalone DDoS. valid values:.
  • protect_all_domains: specifies exclusive Anti-DDoS protection for all domain names in the site. newly added domain names automatically enable exclusive Anti-DDoS protection. when this parameter is specified, DomainDDoSProtections will not be processed.
    • .
  • protect_specified_domains: only applicable to specified domains. specific scope can be set via DomainDDoSProtection parameter.
    • .
members.name: ProtectionOption

members.document:
Anti-DDoS configuration of the domain. specifies the exclusive ddos protection settings for the domain in request parameters.
  • When ProtectionOption remains protect_specified_domains, the domain names not filled in keep their exclusive Anti-DDoS protection configuration unchanged, while explicitly specified domain names are updated according to the input parameters.
    • .
  • When ProtectionOption switches from protect_all_domains to protect_specified_domains: if DomainDDoSProtections is empty, disable exclusive DDoS protection for all domains under the site; if DomainDDoSProtections is not empty, disable or maintain exclusive DDoS protection for the domain names specified in the parameter, and disable exclusive DDoS protection for other unlisted domain names.
    • .
members.name: DomainDDoSProtections

members.document: Specifies the exclusive DDoS protection configuration of a shared CNAME. used as an output parameter.
members.name: SharedCNAMEDDoSProtections

DDosProtectionConfig.document: Exclusive DDoS protection specifications configuration applicable to Layer 4 proxy or web site service.

members.document:
Dedicated anti-DDoS specifications in the Chinese mainland. For details, refer to [Dedicated Anti-DDoS Related Fees](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1552/94162?from_cn_redirect=1).
  • PLATFORM: uses the default protection. Dedicated anti-DDoS is not enabled;
  • BASE30_MAX300: uses dedicated anti-DDoS, which provides 30 Gbps guaranteed protection bandwidth and up to 300 Gbps elastic protection bandwidth;
  • BASE60_MAX600: uses dedicated anti-DDoS, which provides 60 Gbps guaranteed protection bandwidth and up to 600 Gbps elastic protection bandwidth.
    • If this field is not specified, the default value 'PLATFORM' will be used.
members.name: LevelMainland

members.document:
Configuration of elastic protection bandwidth for exclusive DDoS protection in the Chinese mainland.Valid only when exclusive DDoS protection in the Chinese mainland is enabled (refer to the LevelMainland parameter configuration), and the value has the following limitations:
  • When exclusive DDoS protection is enabled in the Chinese mainland and the 30 Gbps baseline protection bandwidth is used (the LevelMainland parameter value is BASE30_MAX300): the value range is 30 to 300 in Gbps;
  • When exclusive DDoS protection is enabled in the Chinese mainland and the 60 Gbps baseline protection bandwidth is used (the LevelMainland parameter value is BASE60_MAX600): the value range is 60 to 600 in Gbps;
  • When the default protection of the platform is used (the LevelMainland parameter value is PLATFORM): configuration is not supported, and the value of this parameter is invalid.
members.name: MaxBandwidthMainland

members.document:
Dedicated anti-DDoS specifications in global regions (excluding the Chinese mainland).
  • PLATFORM: uses the default protection. Dedicated anti-DDoS is not enabled;
  • ANYCAST300: uses dedicated anti-DDoS, which provides 300 Gbps protection bandwidth;
  • ANYCAST_ALLIN: uses dedicated anti-DDoS, which provides all available protection resources.
    • If this field is not specified, the default value 'PLATFORM' will be used.
members.name: LevelOverseas

DeliveryCondition.document: Real-time log delivery conditions used to define the scope of log delivery. The relationship between items in a DeliveryCondition array is "or", whereas the relationship between items in an inner Conditions array is "and".

members.document:
Log filter criteria. The detailed filter criteria are as follows:
  • EdgeResponseStatusCode: Filter by response status code returned from the EdgeOne node to the client.
    ?? Supported operators: equal, great, less, great_equal, less_equal
    ?? Valid values: any integer greater than or equal to 0
  • OriginResponseStatusCode: Filter by response status code of the origin server.
    ?? Supported operators: equal, great, less, great_equal, less_equal.
    ?? Valid values: any integer greater than or equal to -1
  • SecurityAction: Filter by final action after the request matches a security rule.
    ?? Supported operator: equal
    ?? Options:
    ?? -: unknown/not matched
    ?? Monitor: observation
    ?? JSChallenge: JavaScript challenge
    ?? Deny: blocking
    ?? Allow: allowing
    ?? BlockIP: IP blocking
    ?? Redirect: redirection
    ?? ReturnCustomPage: returning to a custom page
    ?? ManagedChallenge: managed challenge
    ?? Silence: silence
    ?? LongDelay: response after a long delay
    ?? ShortDelay: response after a short delay
  • SecurityModule: Filter by name of the security module finally handling the request.
    ??Supported operator: equal
    ??Options:
    ?? -: unknown/not matched
    ?? CustomRule: Custom Rules in Web Protection
    ?? RateLimitingCustomRule: Rate Limiting Rules in Web Protection
    ?? ManagedRule: Managed Rules in Web Protection
    ?? L7DDoS: CC Attack Defense in Web Protection
    ?? BotManagement: Bot Basic Management in Bot Management
    ?? BotClientReputation: Client Reputation Analysis in Bot Management
    ?? BotBehaviorAnalysis: Bot Intelligent Analysis in Bot Management
    ?? BotCustomRule: Custom Bot Rules in Bot Management
    ?? BotActiveDetection: Active Detection in Bot Management
members.name: Conditions

DenyActionParameters.document: Safe execution action specifies additional parameters for the ban.

members.document:
Specifies whether to extend the ban on the source IP. valid values.
  • `on`: Enable;
  • off: Disable.
    • After enabled, continuously blocks client ips that trigger the rule. when this option is enabled, the BlockIpDuration parameter must be simultaneously designated. Note: this option cannot intersect with ReturnCustomPage or Stall.
members.name: BlockIp

members.document: The ban duration when BlockIP is on.
members.name: BlockIpDuration

members.document:
Specifies whether to use a custom page. valid values:.
  • `on`: Enable;
  • off: Disable.
    • Enabled, use custom page content to intercept requests. when this option is enabled, ResponseCode and ErrorPageId parameters must be specified simultaneously. Note: this option cannot intersect with the BlockIp or Stall option.
members.name: ReturnCustomPage

members.document: Status code of the custom page.
members.name: ResponseCode

members.document: Specifies the page id of the custom page.
members.name: ErrorPageId

members.document:
Specifies whether to suspend the request source without processing. valid values:.
  • `on`: Enable;
  • off: Disable.
    • Enabled, no longer responds to requests in the current connection session and does not actively disconnect. used for crawler combat to consume client connection resources. Note: this option cannot intersect with BlockIp or ReturnCustomPage options.
members.name: Stall
